resources.string: Is this an area of high HIV/AIDS prevalence?
Is this a region of high malaria prevalence?
During which season did the child/she/he die?
Date of birth of the deceased
Date of death of the deceased
Last known age of the deceased
Was this a stillbirth or neonatal death?
Name of father or household head
Record the sex of the respondent.
What is the respondent’s relationship to the deceased?
Did the respondent live with the deceased in the period leading to her/his death?
What is the highest level of school you attended?
What is the highest [GRADE/ YEAR] you completed at that level?
Now I would like you to read this sentence to me. (Show card to respondent)
How many people live at (this / that) household?
How many rooms are used for sleeping in the household?
Does the household have a separate room for cooking?
What is the main source of drinking water in this household?
What type of toilet do members of the household usually use?
What is the main source of energy or fuel the household uses for cooking?
What is the main source of energy the household uses for lighting?
What is the main material used for the floor of the house?
What is the main material used for the roof of the house?
What is the main material used for the exterior walls of the house?
Are there other people present during the interview?
In addition to the respondent, how many people are present during the interview? (Please do not include the respondent in the count)
What is each other person’s relationship to the deceased person?
What was the sex of the deceased?
Is the date of birth known?
Is the date of death known?
What was the date of death?
How old was the deceased at the time of death?
Mark the deceased’s age group at the time of death.
If less than 28 days old at death, record the age in days, hours or minutes:
Can only read parts of the statement
No statement in the language requested (Specify the language)
Piped water in the neighbor’s house
No food cooked in the household
On route to a health provider or facility
Was the child part of a multiple birth?">
Was the child the first, second, or later in the birth order?">
Did the mother die before, during or after the delivery?">
How long after the delivery did the mother die?">
How many days after the delivery did the mother die?">
How many weeks after the delivery did the mother die?">
How long after the delivery did the mother die?">
Who (at the facility) delivered the baby?">
At birth, was the baby of usual size?">
At birth, was the baby smaller than usual, (weighing under 2.5 kg)?">
At birth, was the baby very much smaller than usual, (weighing under 1 kg)?">
At birth, was the baby larger than usual, (weighing over 4.5 kg)?">
What was the weight of the deceased at birth?">
Record the source of the birth weight information.">
Was the child born alive or dead?">
Refer to N2012-N2015. If “Dead” and no crying, movement or breathing, mark “Stillbirth.” If “Alive” and N2013-N2015= “No,” or if “Dead” and N2013-N2014 or N2015= “Yes,” then discuss and correct.">
Was the baby moving in the last few days before the birth?">
Did the baby stop moving in the womb before labor started?">
How long before labor did you/the mother last feel the baby move?">
[Enter how long before labor (you / the mother) last felt the baby move, in hours]:">
[Enter how long before labor did (you / the mother) last felt the baby move, in days]:">
Were there any bruises or signs of injury on the baby’s body at birth?">
Was the baby ’s body soft, pulpy and discoloured and the skin peeling away?">
Was any part of the baby physically abnormal at the time of delivery? (for example: body part too large or too small, additional growth on body)">
Did the baby/ child have a swelling or defect on the back at time of birth?">
Did the baby/ child have a very large head at time of birth?">
Did the baby/ child have a very small head at time of birth?">
What was the first or given name(s) of the deceased?">
How old in days was the baby when the illness started?">
Before the illness that led to death, was (the baby / the child) growing normally?">
For how long was (s)he ill before death?">
How many births, including stillbirths, did (you / the baby’s mother) have before this baby?">
During the pregnancy, did (you / the mother) see anyone for antenatal care?">
How many times did (you / the mother) receive antenatal care during this pregnancy?">
During which month of the pregnancy did (you / the mother) first receive antenatal care?">
During which month of the pregnancy did (you / the mother) last receive antenatal care?">
As part of (your / the mother’s) antenatal care during this pregnancy, were any of the following done at least once:">
Please tell me the danger signs during pregnancy or labor and delivery that you should seek care for immediately.">
During this pregnancy, (were you / was the mother) given an injection in the arm to prevent the baby from getting tetanus, that is, convulsions after birth?">
During this pregnancy, how many times did (you / she) get this injection?">
At any time before this pregnancy, did (you / the mother) receive any tetanus injection, either to protect yourself or another baby?">
Before this pregnancy, how many other times did (you / she) receive a tetanus injection?">
During this pregnancy, did (you / the mother) sleep under an insecticide treated bed net?">
During this pregnancy, did (you / the mother) take any drug such as (MOH RECOMMENDED DRUGS) to prevent (you / her) from getting malaria?">
During this pregnancy, how many times did (you / she) take this drug?">
Was the baby born more than one month early?">
How many months long was the pregnancy before the child was born?">
How many hours did the labor and delivery take?">
Was the delivery normal vaginal, without forceps or vacuum?">
Was the delivery vaginal, with forceps or vacuum?">
Was the delivery performed by C-section?">
During labor but before delivery, did (you / the mother) receive any kind of injection?">
Did the water break before labor or during labor?">
How many hours before labor did the water break?">
Was the baby born 24 hours or more after the water broke?">
What was the color of the liquor when the water broke?">
Earlier, you told me that the baby was delivered at (DELIVERY PLACE). Who decided that (this / a health provider or facility) was the right place to deliver the baby?">

If she did not deliver or try to deliver with a health provider or facility (N2006=12 or N2006=1-2 and N2008≠1-3), ask: Did (you / the mother) have any concerns or problems that kept (you / her) from delivering with a health provider or facility?">
What concerns or problems did (you / she) have?">

Now I’d like to ask you about any symptoms (you / the mother) might have had during the late part of the pregnancy. Were the last 3 months of the pregnancy complicated by any of the following symptoms that started before labor?">
Did (you / the mother) seek care from any person or health facility for (any of) the pregnancy symptom(s) that started before labor?">
Where did (you / she) seek this care?">
If more than one symptom started before labor and she sought care from a health provider (Q4003 = 1-4), ask:">
For which symptom(s) did (you / she) go?">

If she never went to a health provider (Q4002 = 2 or Q4003 = only 5-7) for any of the pregnancy symptoms, ask: Did (you / the mother) have any concerns or problems that kept (you / her) from going to a health provider or facility for the problem(s) that started before labor?">
What concerns or problems did (you / she) have?">
(Were you / Was the mother) admitted to hospital for (any of) the symptom(s) that started before labor?">
Now I’d like to ask you about any symptoms (you / the mother) might have had during labor or delivery. Did (you / the mother) have any of the following symptoms during labor or delivery?">
Where (were you / was the mother) when (this / the first) symptom began?">
Did (you / she) ever receive or seek any care or treatment for (any of) the labor or delivery symptom(s) including any care or treatment at home?">
Where did (you / she) receive or seek this care or treatment?">
Who decided that seeing a health provider was the right thing to do?">

Refer to N2006 and N2008 to determine the delivery place and attendant. Discuss with respondent to confirm or correct the delivery place and attendant. Use option 3 or 4 if the woman delivered at home (N2006=1, 2) with a trained nurse or midwife (N2008=2, 3).">
So, including where (you / the mother) received or sought care for the labor or delivery symptom(s) and for the delivery, how many health providers or facilities did (you / she) go to?">
Was there any particular symptom or symptoms for which (you / the mother) went to the (first) health provider?">
How long after the labor or delivery symptom(s) began was it decided to go to the (first) health provider?">

If she delivered at or was on the way to deliver at a health provider or facility (N2006=3-11 or N2006=1-2 and N2008=1-3), read: Earlier you said that (you / the mother) delivered at (DELIVERY PLACE). (Confirm N2006 delivery place and N2008 birth attendant if at home.)">
Did (you / the mother) have to pay any money to travel to this provider?">
How did (you / the mother) arrange for the money to travel?">
What transportation method was used to go there?"
Did (you / the mother) reach the (HEALTH PROVIDER) before delivering the baby?">

After deciding to seek care for (the labor or delivery symptoms / the delivery), how long did it take ((you / the mother) to reach the (LAST HEALTH PROVIDER) / for the (LAST HEALTH PROVIDER) to reach (you / the mother))?">
(Were you / Was the mother) admitted to the hospital?">
Did the (LAST HEALTH PROVIDER) refer (you / the mother) to another health provider or facility?">
Was the baby delivered by the (LAST HEALTH PROVIDER)?">
Now, I’d like to ask about symptoms after the delivery of the baby. Did (you / the mother) have any of the following symptoms that started within 6 weeks after the delivery?">
